channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: House votes to claw back NPR funding. And, Trump keeps control of California Guard
item.description: The House has voted to claw back $1.1 billion in funding for public media. And, an appeals court blocked an earlier ruling ordering Trump to relinquish control of the California Guard.
item.content:encoded:
The House has voted to claw back $1.1 billion in funding for public media. And, an appeals court blocked an earlier ruling ordering Trump to relinquish control of the California Guard.

(Image credit: Charles Dharapak)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Copenhagen is adapting to a warmer world with rain tunnels and 'sponge parks'
item.description: Copenhagen is expected to receive 30% more rainfall by the end of the century. The city is responding with a massive long-term adaptation plan.
item.content:encoded:
Copenhagen is expected to receive 30% more rainfall by the end of the century. The city is responding with a massive long-term adaptation plan.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Why taking apart buildings piece by piece is a climate solution
item.description: Deconstruction is a growing approach to taking down homes that diverts waste from landfills, cuts carbon emissions and creates a circular economy for construction materials.
item.content:encoded:
Deconstruction is a growing approach to taking down homes that diverts waste from landfills, cuts carbon emissions and creates a circular economy for construction materials.

(Image credit: Hart Van Denburg)
item.dc:creator: Rae Solomon

item.title: An AIDS orphan, a pastor and his frantic search for the meds that keep her alive
item.description: In the wake of U.S. aid cuts, Pastor Billy is reminded of his twin sister's death from AIDS. He doesn't want 9-year-old Diana, who's HIV-positive, to meet the same fate.
item.content:encoded: In the wake of U.S. aid cuts, Pastor Billy is reminded of his twin sister's death from AIDS. He doesn't want 9-year-old Diana, who's HIV-positive, to meet the same fate.
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Young men swung for Trump in 2024. Democrats are working on a plan to win them back
item.description: Democrats lost serious ground with young men in the 2024 presidential election. Now, some within the party are working to win them back.
item.content:encoded:
Democrats lost serious ground with young men in the 2024 presidential election. Now, some within the party are working to win them back.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: RFK Jr. sent Congress 'medical disinformation' to defend COVID vaccine schedule change
item.description: A document circulated to members of Congress misinterprets studies and cites debunked research, scientists say. It could influence congressional perceptions of vaccine safety.
item.content:encoded:
A document circulated to members of Congress misinterprets studies and cites debunked research, scientists say. It could influence congressional perceptions of vaccine safety.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Forti√©r

item.title: Did Trump get cheers or jeers at 'Les Mis'? Find out in the quiz
item.description: This week brought the celebrity-starved quiz a cornucopia of fun. Were you paying attention?
item.content:encoded: This week brought the celebrity-starved quiz a cornucopia of fun. Were you paying attention?
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: RFK Jr. overhauled the CDC's vaccine panel. Here's what it does and why it matters
item.description: It plays a big role in deciding which vaccines kids and adults get routinely, what's covered by insurance and which shots are made available free to low-income kids.
item.content:encoded:
It plays a big role in deciding which vaccines kids and adults get routinely, what's covered by insurance and which shots are made available free to low-income kids.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Israel attacks Iran's nuclear and missile sites, prompting retaliation from Tehran
item.description: The Israeli strikes killed top Iranian military leaders and nuclear scientists ahead of planned weekend negotiations aimed at addressing international concerns over Iran's uranium enrichment program.
item.content:encoded:
The Israeli strikes killed top Iranian military leaders and nuclear scientists ahead of planned weekend negotiations aimed at addressing international concerns over Iran's uranium enrichment program.

(Image credit: Vahid Salemi)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: A Texas father builds a brotherhood of dads to support each other
item.description: After his bout with postpartum depression, a Texas father created the "Daddy Stroller Social Club." Now, with chapters in multiple cities, the club has become a way for dads to support each other.
item.content:encoded: After his bout with postpartum depression, a Texas father created the "Daddy Stroller Social Club." Now, with chapters in multiple cities, the club has become a way for dads to support each other.
item.dc:creator: Zanna McKay
